gurmukhi: ieq qy nMdlwl sKw lIey sMg auqY Pun gÍwrn jUQ sbY ] bhsw bhsI qh hon lgI rs bwqn so kib sXwm qbY ]
transliteration: It Te Nand-laal Sakhaa Leee San Outai Gvaaran Jeeth Sabai|| Bashsaa Bahsitah Hon Lagiras Baatan So Kabi Syaam Tabai||
translation: On this side, Krishna was accompanied by his boy-friends and on that side the gopis gathered together and started; a dialogue ensued on various issues concerning pleasure; according to the poet Shyam:

gurmukhi: ijh ko bHmw nhI AMq lKY nh nwrd pwvq jwih CbY ] miRg ijau miRgnI mih rwjq hY hir iqau gn gÍwrn bIc PbY ]524]
transliteration: Lih Ko Brahmaa Nahiant Lakhai Nah Naarad Paavat Jaah(i) Chhabai|| Mrig Jio Mrigadimaih Raajat Hai Har(i) Tio Gad Gvaaran Beech Phabai||524||
translation: The mystery of the Lord could not be known to Brahma and also the sage Narada; just as a deer looks elegant amongst the does in the ssame manner, Krishna amongst the gopis.524.

gurmukhi: nMd lwl llw ieq gwvq hY auq qy sB gÍwrnIXw imil gwvY ] Pwgun kI ruq aUpir AwNbn mwnhu koiklkw kuhkwvY ]
transliteration: Nand Laal Lalaa It Gadvat Hai Out Te Sabh Gvaarneeyaa Mil(i) Gadvai|| Phaagoun Kirout Oopar(i) Aanban Maanoh Kokilakaa Kuhkaavai||
translation: On this side Krishna is singing and on that side the gopis are singing; they seem like the nightingales singing on mango trees in the season in the moth of Phagun;

gurmukhi: qIr ndI soaU gwvq gIq joaU aun ky mn BIqr BwvY ] nYn nC`qR pswr ipKY srdyvbDU imil dyKin AwvY ]525]
transliteration: Teer Nadisooo Gadvat Geet Jooo Oun Ke Man Bheetar Bhaavai|| Nain Nachhattra Pasaar Pikhai Surdev-badhoo Mil(i) Dekhan(i) Aavai||525||
translation: They are singing their favourite songs; the stars of the sky are gazing their splendour with wide-open eyes; the wives of the gods are also coming to see them.525.

gurmukhi: mMfl rws bic`qR mhw sm jy hir kI Bgvwn ncXo hY ] qwhI ky bIc khY kib ieau rs kMcn kI sm quil mcXo hY ]
transliteration: Mandal Raas Bachittra Mahaa Sam Je Har(i) Kibhagvaan Nachyo Hai|| Taahike Beech Kahai Kabi Io Ras Kanchanndkisam Tul9i) Machyo Hai||
translation: That arena of amorous play is wonderful, where Lord Krishna danced; in that arena, the gathering splendid like gold, has raised a tumult regarding the amorous play;

gurmukhi: qw sI bnwieby ko bHmw n bnI kirkY jug koit pcXo hY ] kMcn kY qin gopin ky iqh m`iD mnI mn qu`il gcXo hY ]526]
transliteration: Taa Sibanaaebe Ko Brahmaa Na Banidar(i)kai Joug Kot Joug Kottee Pachyo Hai|| Kanchanndkai Tan(i) Gopan(i) Ke Tih Maddh(i) Maniman Tull(i) Gadhyo Hai||526||
translation: Such a wonderful arena, even Brahma cannot create with his efforts for millions of ages; the bodies of gopis are like gold and their minds seem splendid like pearls.526.

gurmukhi: jl mY sPrI ijm kyl krY iqm gÍwrnIXw hirky sMig folY ] ijau jn Pwg ko Kylq hY iqh BwNq hI kwn ky swQ klolY ]
transliteration: Jal Mai Sapharijim Kel Darai Tim Gvaarneeyaa Har(i)ke San(i) Dolai|| Jio Jan Phaag Ko Khelat Hai Tih Bhaant Hikaan Ke Saath Kadolai||
translation: Just as the fish moves in the water, in the same manner, the gopis are roaming with Krishna; just as the people play Holi fearlessly; in the same manner the gopis are flirting with Krishna;

gurmukhi: koiklkw ijm bolq hY iqm gwvq qw kI brwbr bolY ] sXwm khY sB gÍwrnIXw ieh BwNqn so rs kwnHin colY ]527]
transliteration: Kokilakaa Jim Dolat Hai Tim Gadvat Taa Kibaraabar Dolai|| Syaam Kahai Sabh Gvaaraneeyaa Eh Bhaantan So Ras Kaahnan(i) Ddolai||527||
translation: They are all warbling like a nightingale and are quaffing the Krishna-nectar.527.

gurmukhi: rs kI crcw iqn so Bgvwn krI ihq son kCU km kY ] ieh BwNiq khXo kib sXwm khY qumry mih Kyl binE hm kY ]
transliteration: Ras Kicharchaa Tin So Bhagvaan Karihit Son Kachhodh Kam Kai|| Eh Bhaant(i) Kahyo Kabi Syaam Kahai Toumre Maih Khel Banio Kai||
translation: Lord Krishna held free discussion with them regarding amorous pleasure; the poet says that Krishna said to the gopis, “I have just become like a play for you;”

gurmukhi: kihkY ieh bwq dIXo hiskY su pRBw suB dMqn XoN dmkY ] jn idaus Bly ruiq swvn kI Aiq ABRn mY cplw cmkY ]528]
transliteration: Kah(i)kai Eh Baat Deeyo Has(i)kai Su Prabhaa Soubh Danndan Yon Damkai|| Jan Dios Bhale Rout(i) Saavan Kiat(i) Adhran Mai Chaplaa Chamkai||528||
translation: Saying this, Krishna laughed and his teeth glistened like the flash of lightning in clouds in the month of Sawan.528.

gurmukhi: AYho llw nMd lwl khY sB gÍwrnIXw Aiq mYn BrI ] hmry sMg Awvhu Kyl kro n kCU mn BIqir SMk krI ]
transliteration: Aiho Lalaa Nand Laal Kahai Sabh Gvaarneeyaa At(i) Main Bharee|| Hamre San Aavaoh Khel Daro Na Kachhodh Man Bheetar(i) Shank Daree||
translation: The lustful gopis call Krishna and say, “Krishna! Come and play (sex) with us without hesitation;”

gurmukhi: nYn ncwie kCU muskwie kY Bauh doaU kir tyF DrI ] mn XO aupjI aupmw rs kI mno kwnH ky kMTih PwNs frI ]529]
transliteration: Nain Nachaae Kachhodh Mouskaae Kai Bhauh Dooo Kar(i) Tedh Ddaree|| Man You Oupjioupmaa Ras Kimano Kaahn Ke Kanthah(i) Phaans Daree||529||
translation: They are causing their eyes to dance, they are tilting their eyebrows; it seems that the nose of attachment has fallen on the neck of Krishna.529.
